COLUMBUS , Ohio ( AP ) - The auto club AAA says about 1.34 million Ohioans will travel at least 50 miles from home over the long Memorial Day weekend .

A0: The auto club AAA says about 1.34 million Ohioans will travel at least 50 miles from home over the long Memorial Day weekend
RelatedSentence: AAA says the travel volume - which would be about 0.6 percent higher than the Memorial Day weekend a year ago in the state - is due to an improved economy and more people wanting to get out of town after the long , cold winter .

AAA says the travel volume - which would be about 0.6 percent higher than the Memorial Day weekend a year ago in the state - is due to an improved economy and more people wanting to get out of town after the long , cold winter .
About 90 percent of Ohioans traveling - or about 1.2 million - are expected to drive to their destinations .

The owner of MacQueen Orchards in Holland cut down 1,500 peach trees last week .
His orchard has produced only two percent of its normal crop .
That means the price of homegrown peaches is at a premium .
